content.prompt: Based on the discussion in the second paragraph, which of the following best describes the relationship between advances in medicine and public health efforts in the twentieth century?

choices.label: Many diseases remained impossible to treat, despite technological and medical advances.
Advances in medicine resulted in dramatic reductions of infection rates from all communicable diseases.
The emergence of new diseases offset any medical advances related to the treatment of existing diseases.
Political and economic factors stood in the way of advances in medicine living up to their full global potential.

topic.text: 9.2: Technological Advances and Limitations after 1900 - Disease
